measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule ‒ Short Form (PANAS-SF)
justification: Participants "responded to Likert scale-based questionnaires to assess negative and positive affect ... (13 items from the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule, Short Form, PANAS-SF; Watson et al., 1988)."

measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule ‒ Short Form (PANAS-SF)
justification: The same PANAS-SF items were used "to assess negative and positive affect," indicating the measure also operationalized positive affect.

Protective action intentions were measured with "14 items from the second author's unpublished Weather Risk-taking Scale (WRTS)" that captured behaviors people might engage in before or during severe weather.
Weather fear was assessed using "11 items from his unpublished Fear of Weather Scale (FOWS)."
